sentences.en: Doreen had worked herself into a frenzy .
He seemed in a frenzy and was pounding the door.
sentences.cn: 他好象变得狂乱起来,正在乒乒乓乓地敲门.

sentences.en: He was able to work the young students up into a frenzy.
sentences.cn: 他能激起青年学生的狂热.

sentences.en: He was surrounded by the wild frenzy of jerking chains and suffocating cries.
sentences.cn: 他处在铁链叮当和声嘶力竭的乱叫乱喊中.

sentences.en: His frenzy of the previous day had all calm down.
sentences.cn: 他一脸泰然自若的样子.

sentences.en: His frenzy of the previous day had all calmed down.
sentences.cn: 他前一天的慌乱都平静下来了.

sentences.en: I worked myself into frenzy plotting ways to make him jealous.
sentences.cn: 我绞尽脑汁，处心积虑，就是为了让他嫉妒。

sentences.en: In a frenzy of hate he killed his enemy.
sentences.cn: 他在一阵痛恨之下杀死了他的敌人.

sentences.en: In a little frenzy, he pulled his trousers loose.
sentences.cn: 他手忙脚乱地把裤脚管死命拉出来.

sentences.en: In a moment I'll be crying, she thought in a frenzy of wonder and excitement.
sentences.cn: 再过一会我就要哭了, 她怀着又惊愕又激动的忐忑不安的心情暗自思忖.

sentences.en: The cleverly designed speech lashed the audience into a frenzy.
sentences.cn: 这篇精心设计的演说煽动听众使他们发狂.

sentences.en: The interview whipped up half the people into a frenzy of rage.
sentences.cn: 这一次会谈使半数人极为愤慨.

sentences.en: They were singing in a frenzy of joy.
sentences.cn: 他们欣喜若狂地高声歌唱.

sentences.en: This touched off a frenzy of work through the twilight and into the night.
sentences.cn: 这就激起了工作热情,从黄昏一直干到深夜.

sentences.en: When I started describing the characteristics of Soviet weapons, Smirnov's irritation turned to frenzy.
sentences.cn: 当我开始描述苏联武器的特性时, 斯米尔诺夫恼怒到了发狂的程度.

sentences.en: Your eccentricity and conceit touch the verge of frenzy.
sentences.cn: 你这种反常和自负的行径已经是接近疯狂了.

phrases.tran_cn: 通过新闻媒介无情攻击或利用某人

trans.tran_cn: 狂乱，狂暴，极度的激动，狂怒
trans.tran_en: a state of great anxiety or excitement, in which you cannot control your behaviour
